title: The Fight Over Reform at Linfield University
sub_head: I, with a degree in psychology, was clueless about my options and preparedness to make a living.
body:
Allysia Finley’s “The Weekend Interview with Miles K. Davis: Rebellion in the Faculty Lounge” (May 22) sheds a bright light on the absurdity of the liberal-arts college experience. I, with a degree in psychology, was clueless about my options and preparedness to make a living.
It would help if administrators would list starting incomes for each undergraduate or graduate category in their curriculum—or perhaps that would weaken demand for some cherished disciplines. Would it be outside the realm of possibility to also list trade-school graduates’ incomes?
David Steven
Monterey, Calif.
